thread.title: Suit Up For Chapter 2 with a New John Wick Movie Clip and Featurette
thread.title_full: Suit Up For Chapter 2 with a New John Wick Movie Clip and Featurette

author: Silas Lesnick
title: Suit Up For Chapter 2 with a New John Wick Movie Clip and Featurette
text:
January 26, 2017 SHARE Get ready for next month’s Chapter 2 with a new John Wick movie clip and behind the scenes featurette 
Next month, the world’s greatest hitman returns to the big screen. Chapter 2 offers a followup to the 2014 hit John Wick movie and today we’ve got two video looks at what audiences can expect from the Keanu Reeves action sequel. In the top player below, you can check out a new clip wherein John Wick goes in for a fitting at a decidedly unique Italian tailor. In the second player below, you can watch a behind the scenes featurette that has Reeves discussing the various levels of training he underwent for the film. What’s more, we’ve also added a new poster for the film that you can see in the gallery viewer at the bottom of this page! 
RELATED: The John Wick: Chapter 2 Trailer is Here! 
A Lionsgate release, John Wick: Chapter 2 has director Chad Stahelski returning to helm. Common has also joined the franchise as the sequel’s chief antagonist, and the film also stars Riccardo Scamarcio, Laurence Fishburne, Ruby Rose , Bridget Moynahan , Lance Reddick , Franco Nero, John Leguizamo , and Ian McShane. 
John Wick screenwriter Derek Kolstad returned for the sequel, which is produced by Thunder Road’s Basil Iwanyk. Iwanyk also produced the first film which was made on a modest $20 million budget. From that, the first John Wick movie earned more than $86 million at the worldwide box office and also became a hit in the home video market. 
John Wick: Chapter 2 opens in theaters on February 10, 2017. 
Are you planning to check out the new John Wick movie sequel on the big screen? Let us know in the comments below and check back soon as we’ll soon be bringing you video interviews with the cast as well as a behind the scenes look at director Chad Stahelski’s 87Eleven Action Design!
